content: AMEX Singapore KrisFlyer Card Credit Card Asked by AnonymousAsked on 07 Nov 2018Do I need to sign up for Krisflyer account before I can use the Amex Krisflyer credit card?I just got my new AMEX card and I want to make a SIA flight purchase. But I don't have a Krisflyer account currently, do I need to sign up for one first or do I just use my card directly and the points will be accounted for elsewhere?2 answersAnswerBump0

Kenneth Lou, Co-founder at SeedlyLevel 8. WizardUpdated on 07 Jun 2019Hey! I also had this question when I first started flying on my own.I would say, just create a free Krisflyer account! You can create one for free here: https://www.singaporeair.com/en_UK/ppsclub-krisflyer/registration-form/Not only for the Amex krisflyer, but every other points card, if you would want to collect krisflyer points, this is how to do it and your krisflyer account is the place to collect them. 2 comments1

MasterAnswered on 02 May 2019It depends on what the AMEX card is.If yours is AMEX Rewards Card, then you earn AMEX membership rewards points, which is stored in your AMEX account till you are ready to redeem.If yours is AMEX Krisflyer Blue, then no, you must have a Krisflyer account. Or else AMEX would not know where to credit the points to and you might lose them.0 comments0
